name: Dawn Jutla
known-for: Top 100 of Canada's Most Powerful Women

anecdotes.title: PhD in Computer Science
anecdotes.body: Jutla completed her Ph.D. in Computer Science at the Technical University of Nova Scotia (now Dalhousie University) in 1997. Her 1996 Ph.D. work on multi-view access control has been cited in Xerox, IBM, and Koninklijke Philips Electronics' US patents.

anecdotes.title: Research
anecdotes.body: Her research has received over 850 citations in the areas of information system design and models for electronic business, e-business readiness, government, and online privacy.
anecdotes.note: Google Scholar reports a total of 1317 citations.

anecdotes.title: Awards
anecdotes.body: She was the 2009 winner of the World Technology Award for IT Software in the Individual Category. She convened and now co-chairs the OASIS Privacy by Design Documentation for Software Engineers (PbD-SE) Technical Committee, and is active in OASIS Privacy Management Reference Model's Technical Committee. She served on the OASIS Board of Directors for the term 2012-2016.

anecdotes.title: Founder
anecdotes.body: Under her leadership, the new Master of Technology Entrepreneurship and Innovation at St Mary University was developed in 5 months. She is also the Chief Executive Officer of Peer Ledger, a Blockchain company targeting Pharma, Healthcare, Precious Metals and Industrial Minerals, and other highly-regulated sectors.
